div.div: Chapter . Teach, Meet, and Learn with Zoom
Zoom is an online video conferencing system now available to the UMN community!
When to Use Zoom vs Google Hangouts Meet

Compare the features of Zoom (
umn.zoom.us) and Google Hangouts Meet (
meet.google.com) to help you decide which tool is best for your needs. Google Hangouts Meet is the simplest tool and interface for online meetings, but Zoom offers many additional features.
The Zoom for Canvas Integration allows UMN faculty and staff to use the following Zoom features within Canvas.
Follow these steps to add the Zoom integration to each Canvas course you want to use with Zoom.
Host a Zoom Meeting Within Canvas
Follow these steps as an instructor in order to host a Zoom meeting within a Canvas course.
Follow these instructions to use the breakout rooms feature in Zoom.

h1.span: Teach, Meet, and Learn with Zoom

div.p: Zoom is an online video conferencing system now available to the UMN community!

Zoom can be used by teachers to hold class meetings, by teachers/students for video conference meetings, and by students for learning tasks. If you are using Zoom for more advanced tasks, such as presenting at meetings, scheduling meetings, or acting as support for Zoom events and webinars, check out Schedule, Support, and Present.

h2.span: When to Use Zoom vs Google Hangouts Meet

div.p: Compare the features of Zoom (umn.zoom.us) and Google Hangouts Meet (meet.google.com) to help you decide which tool is best for your needs. Google Hangouts Meet is the simplest tool and interface for online meetings, but Zoom offers many additional features.

section.h3: Best Use Practices for Zoom and Google Hangouts Meet

tr.td: Professional meetings and interviews that you want recorded

section.h3: Features of Zoom and Google Hangouts Meet

tr.td: More than one at a time
Up to 300 in meetings; 1000 in webinars
All faculty, staff, and students can host meetings; only faculty and staff can host webinars
Faculty, staff, and students can host a meetings

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: The Zoom for Canvas Integration allows UMN faculty and staff to use the following Zoom features within Canvas.

li.p: Create Calendar events for Zoom meetings
Create Canvas Conversations about Zoom meetings
Record Zoom meetings to the cloud (for non-HCC account holders only)

div.p: Follow these steps to add the Zoom integration to each Canvas course you want to use with Zoom.

li.span: In the same browser, log into canvas.umn.edu
Select the course you would like to add Zoom to.
In the course navigation menu on the left-hand side of the screen, select Settings.
In the list of menu options,

ul.li: Zoom if you are NOT in the HCC.

li.p: Zoom for BAA if you are in the HCC

NOTE: Students whose BAA status differs froselect the correct instance of Zoom for your account:m the instructor's will not be able to use the Zoom integration in Canvas for that particular course. We therefore recommend posting the class Zoom meeting link in a public area of the Canvas course in addition to scheduling a meeting directly within the Zoom integration in Canvas to accommodate the students with a different BAA status.
Select Enable to move Zoom into your Navigation menu.

li.span: At the bottom of the page, select Save. Zoom now appears in the course navigation menu.
When you access Zoom for the first time through the course navigation menu, you will need to select the Authorize option in order to proceed.

h2.span: Host a Zoom Meeting Within Canvas

div.p: Follow these steps as an instructor in order to host a Zoom meeting within a Canvas course.
div.section:
After adding Zoom to a course, you can access the Zoom tool from the course navigation menu. Then you can schedule a meeting.
Note: You must have instructor access to Canvas in order to create or host your own meetings; students do not have access to this feature.

li.span: Select Zoom from the left-hand course navigation menu.

ul.li: Follow the same steps to schedule a single Zoom meeting that you would use outside of Canvas.

li.span: To schedule a recurring meeting, select the Recurring Meeting checkbox. You are able to set the following features:

ul.li: How many sessions, or occurrences, the meeting will have
The date of the final occurrence

div.div: Note: When you schedule a recurring meeting, each occurrence creates as an independent event. This means that if you need to modify all instances of a meeting, you must edit each event individually.

div.p: Follow these instructions to use the breakout rooms feature in Zoom.

section.div:
Breakout rooms allow you to split your Zoom meeting into separate sessions. The meeting host or co-host can split the participants of the meeting into these separate sessions automatically or manually, or they can allow participants to select and enter breakout sessions as they please.
Note: The Zoom for Canvas Integration does not allow faculty and staff to create breakout rooms before the Zoom meeting within Canvas.

li.span: Select the number of rooms you would like to create, and how you would like to assign your participants to those rooms:

li.p: Assign Automatically: Let Zoom split your participants up evenly into each of the rooms.
Assign manually: Choose which participants you would like in each room.
Let participants choose room: Participants can select and enter rooms on their own.
Load pre-assigned rooms: Choose from pre-assignments or previously saved assignments.

li.span: Your rooms will be created, but will not start automatically. You can manage the rooms prior to starting them by clicking Options (on Windows) or the gear icon (on macOS) to view additional breakout room options.
ClickOpen All Rooms to start the breakout rooms.
